alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 7:22AM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Lexington and Richland. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 721 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, Oak Grove, St. Andrews, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, Dentsville, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Riverbanks Zoo, West Columbia Riverwalk, Columbia Metro Airport, SC State Fair Grounds and Five Points. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 26 between mile markers 103 and 117. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 46 and 81. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 22. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
